passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • William Faulkner, a prolific American writer, was born in Mississippi in 1897. • Faulkner's works often explore themes of Southern society and its complexities. • 'As I Lay Dying,' one of Faulkner's most famous novels, utilizes a stream-of-consciousness narrative style. • The novel features multiple narrators, which enhances the complexity and depth of the story.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to explain a unique aspect of 'As I Lay Dying'?

choices.A: William Faulkner was born in Mississippi and wrote 'As I Lay Dying,' which was set in the South.
choices.B: Faulkner's works, including 'As I Lay Dying,' often explore themes of Southern society.
choices.C: The novel 'As I Lay Dying' was written by William Faulkner, who was born in 1897.
choices.D: 'As I Lay Dying' employs a stream-of-consciousness narrative style and features multiple narrators, adding complexity to the story.

explanation: D: 'As I Lay Dying' employs a stream-of-consciousness narrative style and features multiple narrators, adding complexity to the story. This choice is the correct answer because it effectively explains a unique aspect of 'As I Lay Dying' by describing its narrative style and the use of multiple narrators to enhance the story's complexity.
distractor_explanation: 'William Faulkner was born in Mississippi and wrote 'As I Lay Dying,' which was set in the South.' is incorrect because it does not discuss the unique aspects of the novel's narrative style.

'Faulkner's works, including 'As I Lay Dying,' often explore themes of Southern society.' is incorrect because it provides only a general overview of Faulkner's works and does not focus on the unique aspects of 'As I Lay Dying.'

'The novel 'As I Lay Dying' was written by William Faulkner, who was born in 1897.' is incorrect because it only provides biographical information about the author and does not discuss the unique aspects of 'As I Lay Dying.'
